NewsDetail.Name: Business Program Provides Opportunities
NewsDetail.Title: Business Program Provides Opportunities
NewsDetail.Abstract: “Starting my own business pushed me over the edge and made me want to major in business management.” Brian Nielson, Freshman
NewsDetail.Author: Lizzie Gallardo
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
The Department of Business Management is helping students to become more successful as entrepreneurs.

Brian Nielson, a freshman studying business management has already begun a business called Shredelicious, selling snowboard apparel such as T-shirts, flat brimmed hats and stickers.

"Starting my own business pushed me over the edge and made me want to major in business management,"  Nielson said.

The business management department at BYU-Idaho encourages students to apply business skills.

"Instead of just reading, we do business," said Kent Lundin, the Business Management Department chair.

Often, students already have creative business ideas, but need more guidance and knowledge of the basic skills in order to be efficient and successful in the world of business.

"I already have an idea of everything, but in class I hope to learn more about accounting and marketing, how to get the product out there and how to run my own business more efficiently," Nielson said.

Nielson said he wants to apply what he learns in his classes to help build his business.

He wants to eventually make anything that can be shredded on such as snowboards, surfboards and skateboards.
